definition: to fill a vacancy/to make up for a shortage/to supply a deficiency
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
to remedy omissions and correct errors (idiom)
see 拾遺補缺|拾遗补缺[shi2 yi2 bu3 que1]

sentences.english: Vacancies in the House of Representatives are filled only by a special election or in a general election.
sentences.chinese: 衆議員補缺要通過專門選舉或隨大選進行。

sentences.english: The research on idioms of a book is important to the ancient books.
sentences.chinese: 專書成語研究對古籍的今注今譯有着糾謬補缺的作用。

sentences.english: We go to by- elections, and work a - gainst the Government.
sentences.chinese: 我們去參加補缺選舉，反對政府。

sentences.english: This book is not complete yet, there is still much to be added.
sentences.chinese: 完善，還有需要拾遺補缺的地方。

sentences.english: A hiring manager may fill a vacancy but cannot hire a relative.
sentences.chinese: 僱傭經理可以補缺，但不能僱傭親戚。

definition: to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
to interpret (a visual document, a medical exam, an historical event etc)/to analyze data (from a chip, a black box etc)
name and reality/how sth is portrayed and what it is actually like
lit. to mend the pen after sheep are lost (idiom)/fig. to act belatedly/better late than never/to lock the stable door after the horse has bolted
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
